矮鶏檜葉: (チャボヒバ) - Chamaecyparis obtusa var. breviramea (ornamental variety of hinoki cypress)
矮鹿: (マメジカ) - chevrotain (Tragulidae spp.); mouse deer
矯めつ眇めつ: (ためつすがめつ) - scrutiny; scanning; taking a good look
矯めなおす: (ためなおす) - to set up again; to correct; to cure
矯める: (ためる) - to straighten/to correct/to cure; to falsify
矯め直す: (ためなおす) - to set up again; to correct; to cure
矯味剤: (きょうみざい) - taste masking agent; flavoring substance
矯正: (kyousei) - correction (de falha, defeito, imperfeição, etc.), remedy, rectification, redress, reform
矯正施設: (きょうせいしせつ) - correctional facility (for juveniles); juvenile detention centre (center); reformatory
矯正職員: (きょうせいしょくいん) - correctional officer; corrections officer
矯正視力: (きょうせいしりょく) - corrected eyesight
矯角殺牛: (きょうかくさつぎゅう) - (yoji) trying to straighten the horns of a bull, and killing it in the process; trying to correct a small defect and ruining the whole thing; The cure is worse than the disease
矯飾: (きょうしょく) - affectation; pretense; pretence
石うす: (いしうす) - stone mortar; millstone; quern
石が流れて木の葉が沈む: (いしがながれてこのはがしずむ) - (proverb)  there are exceptions to every rule; rocks will flow and leaves will sink
石けり: (いしけり) - form of hopscotch in which the player kicks a stone through the course
石こう: (せっこう) - plaster; gypsum; calcium sulphate (sulfate)
石さじ: (いしさじ) - stone knife (Jomon-period tool, shaped like a rice spoon)
石だたみ: (いしだたみ) - (flat) stone paving/sett/flagstone; (chocolate) pavé/various rectangular pastries, esp. layered chocolate
石つぶて: (いしつぶて) - throwing stone; sling stone; slingshot; pellet; pebble; small rock
石づき: (いしづき) - shoe; ferrule (of an umbrella); butt end (of a lance); hard tip (of mushroom)
石にかじりついてでも: (いしにかじりついてでも) - (to get something done) even if through hell and high water
石にかじりついても: (いしにかじりついても) - (to get something done) even if through hell and high water
石にしがみついても: (いしにしがみついても) - (incorrect variant of 石にかじりついても)  (to get something done) even if through hell and high water
石に漱ぎ流れに枕す: (いしにくちすすぎながれにまくらす) - refusing to admit being wrong and adhering to the far-fetched argument
石に齧りついてでも: (いしにかじりついてでも) - (to get something done) even if through hell and high water
石に齧りついても: (いしにかじりついても) - (to get something done) even if through hell and high water
石に齧り付いてでも: (いしにかじりついてでも) - (to get something done) even if through hell and high water
石の上にも三年: (いしのうえにもさんねん) - perseverance prevails; three years on a (cold) stone (will make the stone warm)
石の帯: (いしのおび) - special leather belt used in ceremonial court dress, covered in black lacquer and decorated with stones and jewels
石れき: (せきれき) - pellet; pebble; small rock
石亀: (イシガメ) - any turtle of the genus Mauremys (esp. the Japanese pond turtle, Mauremys japonica)
石亭: (せきてい) - The Sekitei (name of an inn)
石人: (いしひと) - stone image of people
石仏: (いしぼとけ) - stone Buddhist image; (いしぼとけ only) unemotional person/taciturn person
石偏: (いしへん) - kanji "stone" radical at left
石刻: (せっこく) - stone carving or engraving
石刻文: (せっこくぶん) - stone inscription; epigraphy
石剣: (せっけん) - sword-shaped stoneware found in archeological sites in eastern Japan dating to the end of the Jomon period
石匕: (せきひ) - stone knife (Jomon-period tool, shaped like a rice spoon)
石化: (せっか) - mineralization; mineralisation; petrifaction; fossilization; fossilisation
石匙: (いしさじ) - stone knife (Jomon-period tool, shaped like a rice spoon)
石千鳥: (イシチドリ) - stone curlew; thick-knee (Burhinus oedicnemus)
石器: (せっき) - stone implement (e.g. stone age arrowheads); stone tool
石器文化: (せっきぶんか) - stone age culture
石地蔵: (いしじぞう) - stone statue of Jizo (often found along roads); taciturn person/person uninterested in romance
石垣鯛: (イシガキダイ) - rock porgy (Oplegnathus punctatus); spotted knifejaw
石塔: (せきとう) - stone monument or pagoda
石壁: (せきへき) - stone wall/dry wall; rocky cliff/stone precipice
石子詰め: (いしこづめ) - burying alive beneath stones
石川県: (いしかわけん) - Ishikawa prefecture (Hokuriku area)
石川蛙: (イシカワガエル) - Ishikawa's frog (Odorrana ishikawae)
石帯: (せきたい) - special leather belt used in ceremonial court dress, covered in black lacquer and decorated with stones and jewels
石弓: (いしゆみ) - crossbow (incl. large models operated by a number of people); netted apparatus atop a wall containing large stones, which were dropped onto attackers by cutting the net; slingshot/catapult
石打: (いしうち) - rock fight/stone-throwing fight; custom by which neighbours or friends threw rocks inside a couple's house on their wedding night
石打ち: (いしうち) - rock fight/stone-throwing fight; custom by which neighbours or friends threw rocks inside a couple's house on their wedding night
石抱き: (いしだき) - form of torture in which the victim kneels on triangular wedges and stone slabs are placed on their lap
石持: (イシモチ) - white croaker; blue drum (Pennahia argentata)
石摺り: (いしずり) - print from stone; rubbing; rubbed copy
石敷: (いしじき) - stone paving; stone paved area
石文: (いしぶみ) - stone monument bearing an inscription (esp. memorial for future generations); stele; stela
